user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_dir_tell:
```c
lfs_soff_t lfs_dir_tell(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_dir_t *dir) {
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    LFS_TRACE("lfs_dir_tell(%p, %p)", (void*)lfs, (void*)dir);

    lfs_soff_t res = lfs_dir_tell_(lfs, dir);

    LFS_TRACE("lfs_dir_tell -> %"PRId32, res);
    LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg);
    return res;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function lfs_dir_tell:
static lfs_soff_t lfs_dir_tell_(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_dir_t *dir) {
    (void)lfs;
    return dir->pos;
}
...
#define LFS_LOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg,0)
...
#define LFS_UNLOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg)
...
#define LFS_TRACE(__VA_ARGS__) 
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Other code fragments present in the provided code do not need investigation for indirect or direct self-calls: the macros LFS_LOCK, LFS_UNLOCK and LFS_TRACE are defined in the additional code and expand to no function calls or side effects (they are simple no-op / cast expressions), so they cannot introduce indirect recursion. No other functions or call sites are present in the supplied snippets that could form an indirect call chain back to lfs_dir_tell or lfs_dir_tell_. Therefore only the two function definitions above need to be inspected for potential self-calls or mutual recursion.
